channel.title: Help me please!
channel.description:
Ok, so when I click run the box says " 'java' is not known as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . ."
What do i do to fix it so it is actually running?
I have JDK 6 Update 13

item.title: Help me please!
item.dc:creator: @Lawl_Rox Lawl Rox
item.description:
@Lawl_Rox wrote:

Thanks, but i have a question, in the classpath code do I add the CLASSPATH= at the beginning like you did?

EDIT: I just added the pic of what the box says when i click run.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 18, 2009, 05:05:59 am[/size][hr]Denoria, This is what my run.bat file looks like:

@echo off
color 1f
title Project-Zh Runner
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
pause[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 18, 2009, 05:07:27 am[/size][hr]should I replace mine with the one you posted?

Read full topic

item.title: Help me please!
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“Lawl Rox, post:5, topic:274134”]Ok, so you know the codes they want you to put in the CLASSPATH and Path variables thingy? well when you make a server you’re suppost to fix the codes to your version of java. I was wondering if you could tell me the codes, or atleast tell me where to insert my verson of java. It says to switch the codes to your version of java in this link:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Thanks![/quote]CLASSPATH:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin

Edit:
and if your run.bat looks something like this: (Note: Don’t replace ur run.bat with this tho)

@echo off COLOR F4 title Compiler "C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\JAVA" server pause

because jdk1.6.0_13 is your JDK version code.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me please!
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“Lawl Rox, post:3, topic:274134”][quote author=Denoria link=topic=362238.msg2753502#msg2753502 date=1240051090]
Hi there, Look at this guide on How To Make A Server and find the environment variables, this will help you, you need to set them.

Thanks,
Denoria.
[/quote]

Thank you for the answer, but sadly I have already set my enviroment variables, but you can still help me. I know you have to insert your JDK version so can you post the codes up here for CLASSPATH and Path for version JDK 6 update 13. I got confused at that part.[/quote]Ok So what do you want me to help you on? related to the environment varibles?

Read full topic

Thanks,
Denoria.[/quote]

Thank you for the answer, but sadly I have already set my enviroment variables, but you can still help me. I know you have to insert your JDK version so can you post the codes up here for CLASSPATH and Path for version JDK 6 update 13. I got confused at that part.

Thanks,
Denoria.
